Updated November     pm



Following an  victory over Love  Basketball Saturday the UW womens basketball team will conclude exhibition play tonight when they face off against Seattle Pacific University at  p.m PERIOD in Hec Edmundson Pavilion PERIOD

 coach Tia Jackson said to GoHuskies.com PERIOD 

The SPU Falcons have appeared in the NCAA Division II Tournament  straight times and made it to the second round of play last year before falling to Chico State PERIOD

The Falcons also have a former Husky on their roster PERIOD Senior guard Jackie Hollands transferred to SPU from Washington in  and will be making her first appearance against the Huskies tonight PERIOD

If the victory over Love  Basketball is any indication of how the Huskies will perform tonight SPU may want to keep a close watch on UW sophomore Sami Whitcomb who led the Husky women with  points and junior forward Heidi McNeill who collected a game high15 rebounds PERIOD

Jackson has been impressed by McNeills progress over the past year PERIOD

 Jackson said PERIOD 

The offensive abilities of the Husky women were on full display Saturday as five players scored in double figures and the team put up  points in the second half PERIOD Although the win came easily Jackson said she would like to see some improvement on the defensive end PERIOD

 Jackson said on GoHuskies.com PERIOD 

Tonights exhibition match is free for all to attend and will be the last home game for the Husky women until late November PERIOD

Reach reporter Allen Wagner at sportsthedaily.washington.edu. log In
